meanings.definition: To strip (something) of its covering or surface
meanings.sent1: The strong winds denuded the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers denuded the old building of its paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel denuded the garden of all its flowers.
meanings.sent4: The artist denuded the canvas of color, leaving only black and white.
meanings.sent5: The storm denuded the beach of sand, revealing only rocks underneath.

meanings.sent1: The swimmer denuded himself before entering the pool.
meanings.sent2: The deforestation denuded the once lush forest.
meanings.sent3: The magician denuded the volunteer of all their belongings.
meanings.sent4: The winter denuded the landscape of all greenery, leaving it barren.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor denuded the marble block, revealing the masterpiece within.

meanings.definition: Lacking a natural or usual covering
meanings.sent1: The denuded tree stood stark against the sky.
meanings.sent2: The denuded hillside showed the scars of erosion.
meanings.sent3: The denuded cake was missing its frosting.
meanings.sent4: The denuded mountain revealed its rocky core.
meanings.sent5: The denuded forest echoed with the sounds of wildlife.
